ComicInfo.Summary:
12 Reasons To Die is a brutal tale of gangsters, betrayal, and one vengeful soul hunting the 12 Dons who conspired his murder. Created by Ghostface Killah and produced by RZA, this hard-knuckled horror/crime hybrid follows multiple timelines - and multiple artists - in the quest for revenge.
*List of covers and their creators:* Cover | Name | Creator(s) | Sidebar Location | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- A | Cover A | Christopher Mitten | 1 | B | Cover B | Ronald Wimberly | 2 | RI | Ghost Variant | Jason Jagel | 3 | RE | "Ticket" Variant (Limited to 150 copies; signed by Ghostface Killah and allowing access to one of his concerts) | Matt Pizzolo (d) | 4 | RE | "Suspiria" Variant (Limited to 100 signed & numbered copies; released at C2E2; homage to the 1977 Italian horror movie of the same name) | Shaky Kane (a) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 5 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Austin Books | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 6 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Brave New Worlds | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 7 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Casablanca Comics | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 8 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Chapel Hill Comics | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 9 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Forbidden Planet | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 10 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Graham Crackers | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 11 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Heroes' Haven Exclusive | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 12 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Jim Hanley's Universe | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 13 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Newbury Comics | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 14 | RE | "Tour" Variant - Third Eye Comics | Soul Temple (d) & Matt Pizzolo (d) | 15 | Notes:
The "Ticket" variant was only available in stores that also participated in the "Tour" variant program. Besides having an exclusive variant signed by Ghostface Killah, the owner of the "Ticket" variant was also put on the guest list for the local concert.
